name: National Guard State Tuition/Fee Waiver
description: 100% tuition and fees waived at 28 Massachusetts state colleges and universities for National Guard members. Maximum 130 credit hours. Must obtain Certificate of Eligibility every 30 credits. Commonwealth-funded program.
eligibility: Active Massachusetts National Guard member in good standing
Enrolled at participating MA public institution
Obtain Certificate of Eligibility every 30 credits from Education Office
benefit_amount: 100% tuition + fees for up to 130 credit hours
how_to_apply: Contact MA National Guard Education Office at massnationalguard.org
source_name: Massachusetts National Guard

name: Free Tuition for Veterans and Active Duty
description: Veterans and active-duty service members who are permanent legal Massachusetts residents receive FREE tuition at state institutions of higher education.
benefit_amount: FREE tuition at Massachusetts state institutions
how_to_apply: Submit DD-214 or active duty orders to institution's veterans office
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Massachusetts Soldiers Legacy Fund
description: Educational assistance funds for children of Massachusetts service members who died in the Global War on Terror. Provides financial support for college expenses.
eligibility: Child of MA service member who died in Global War on Terror
benefit_amount: Educational assistance funds (amount varies)
how_to_apply: Apply through Massachusetts EOVS Office of Student and Family Support
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: National Guard Dependent Education Transfer
description: National Guard members may be able to transfer unused education benefits to dependents. Certain restrictions and limits apply.
benefit_amount: Transfer of unused education benefits to dependents
how_to_apply: Contact Massachusetts National Guard Education Office
source_name: Massachusetts National Guard

name: Clause 22 - $400 Property Tax Exemption
description: $400 annual property tax exemption for veterans, their spouses, surviving spouses, or Gold Star parents. Must have served during wartime or received expeditionary medal.
eligibility: Veteran OR spouse OR surviving spouse OR Gold Star parent
MA resident 6 months before service OR 5 years after
Served during wartime OR expeditionary medal
benefit_amount: $400 annual property tax exemption
how_to_apply: File annually by April 1 with local assessor with DD-214
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Clause 22A-E - $750 Property Tax Exemption
description: $750 annual property tax exemption for veterans with specific service-connected disabilities including loss of limbs, paraplegic, Purple Heart recipients, or Medal of Honor recipients.
eligibility: Veteran with qualifying disability: loss of limb, paraplegic, Purple Heart, or Medal of Honor
MA resident 6 months before service OR 5 years after
benefit_amount: $750 annual property tax exemption
how_to_apply: File annually by April 1 with local assessor with VA documentation
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Clause 22F - $1,000 Property Tax Exemption
description: $1,000 annual property tax exemption for veterans rated 100% disabled by the VA.
eligibility: Massachusetts resident 6 months before service OR 5 years after
benefit_amount: $1,000 annual property tax exemption
how_to_apply: File annually by April 1 with local assessor with VA rating letter
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Clause 22G - $1,250 Property Tax Exemption
description: $1,250 annual property tax exemption for veterans with specific severe disabilities including loss of both arms/legs/eyes or permanently bedridden.
eligibility: Veteran with severe disability: loss of both arms/legs/eyes OR permanently bedridden
MA resident 6 months before service OR 5 years after
benefit_amount: $1,250 annual property tax exemption
how_to_apply: File annually by April 1 with local assessor with VA documentation
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Clause 22H - $1,500 Property Tax Exemption
description: $1,500 annual property tax exemption for veterans rated permanently and totally disabled by VA AND living in specially adapted housing.
eligibility: MA resident 6 months before service OR 5 years after
benefit_amount: $1,500 annual property tax exemption
how_to_apply: File annually by April 1 with local assessor with VA SAH documentation
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption
description: All military retirement pay is completely exempt from Massachusetts state income tax.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on all military retirement income
how_to_apply: Exclude from Massachusetts income tax return
source_name: Massachusetts Department of Revenue

name: Survivor Benefit Plan Tax Exemption
description: Survivor pensions (SBP, RCSBP, RSFPP) paid to surviving spouse age 62+ are not taxed in Massachusetts.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on survivor benefit plans
how_to_apply: Exclude from Massachusetts income tax return
source_name: Massachusetts Department of Revenue

name: Combat Pay and Combat Zone Tax Extension
description: Military pay from combat zone excluded from federal adjusted gross income is also exempt from MA income tax. Service members have 180 days from combat zone return to file taxes.
benefit_amount: 100% exemption on combat zone pay + 180-day filing extension
how_to_apply: Follows federal exclusion automatically
source_name: Massachusetts Department of Revenue

name: Motor Vehicle Excise Tax Exemption
description: Resident service members deployed or stationed outside MA for 180+ continuous days in a calendar year are eligible for one motor vehicle excise tax exemption. Service members wounded or killed do not need to meet 180-day requirement.
eligibility: Deployed/stationed outside MA 180+ days OR wounded/killed in conflict
benefit_amount: Exemption on one vehicle's excise tax
how_to_apply: Apply to local tax assessor with military orders
source_name: Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles

name: Vehicle Sales Tax Exemption for Disabled Veterans
description: Disabled veterans with loss or permanent loss of use of both legs/arms, or one leg and one arm, may receive motor vehicle sales tax exemption on one vehicle for personal non-commercial use.
eligibility: Loss or permanent loss of use of both legs/arms OR one leg and one arm
OR approved for MA Disabled Veteran license plate
benefit_amount: Sales tax exemption on one vehicle
how_to_apply: Apply through MA RMV with VA disability documentation
source_name: Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles

name: Massachusetts Disabled Veteran Annuity
description: Annual annuity payment for qualifying disabled veterans. HERO Act increased annuity from $2,000 to $2,500 phased over 2 years. $1,250 paid February 2025, then $2,500 annually starting August 2025 in one payment.
eligibility: MA resident at application and ongoing
Blind, paralyzed, double amputee certified by VA OR 100% VA disability rating
benefit_amount: $2,500 per year (one annual payment starting August 2025)
how_to_apply: Apply through Massachusetts EOVS
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Gold Star Parent/Spouse Annuity
description: $2,500 annual annuity for parents or unremarried surviving spouse of service member who died in line of duty or from service-connected cause.
eligibility: Service member died in line of duty OR from service-connected cause
MA resident at application and ongoing
benefit_amount: $2,500 per year (one annual payment starting August 2025)
how_to_apply: Apply through Massachusetts EOVS
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Wartime Service Bonus
description: One-time bonus for Massachusetts veterans of designated campaigns. Amount ranges from $200 to $1,000 depending on operation and length of service. In case of veteran's death, spouse and children may be eligible.
eligibility: Living in MA immediately before entry into armed forces
OR surviving family of deceased veteran
benefit_amount: $200 to $1,000 one-time bonus
how_to_apply: Apply through Massachusetts EOVS
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Chapter 115 Benefits
description: Means-tested financial, medical, and dental assistance for eligible veterans and dependents. Provides support for food, shelter, clothing, fuel, and medical care. HERO Act expanded coverage.
eligibility: Administered through municipal Veterans Services offices
benefit_amount: Financial support for basic needs based on means test
how_to_apply: Contact local Veterans Service Officer (all 351 MA municipalities have VSOs)
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: HERO Act Behavioral Health Treatment Reimbursement
description: NEW HERO Act provision: Veterans can be reimbursed for visits to outpatient behavioral health providers, expanding access to mental health treatment.
benefit_amount: Reimbursement for outpatient behavioral health visits
how_to_apply: Apply through Massachusetts EOVS for reimbursement
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Veterans Employment Hiring Preference
description: Veterans hiring preference for Massachusetts state government positions. Provides priority consideration in civil service hiring.
eligibility: Applying for state civil service position
benefit_amount: Hiring preference for state positions
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state job applications with DD-214
source_name: Massachusetts Human Resources Division

name: VET-HIRE Tax Credit for Employers (HERO Act)
description: HERO Act increased tax credit to $2,500 for small businesses hiring veterans. Incentivizes veteran employment across Commonwealth.
benefit_amount: $2,500 tax credit per veteran hired (increased by HERO Act)
how_to_apply: Employers apply through MA Department of Revenue
source_name: Massachusetts Department of Revenue

name: Commercial Driver License (CDL) Skills Test Waiver
description: Veterans with military experience operating vehicles equivalent to commercial motor vehicles can apply for CDL without skills testing. Knowledge tests cannot be waived. School bus and passenger endorsements not transferable.
eligibility: Currently licensed OR employed within past year operating military equivalent of CMV
benefit_amount: Waiver of CDL skills test
how_to_apply: Submit CDL skills test waiver form to Massachusetts RMV
source_name: Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles

name: Free Hunting and Fishing Licenses for Disabled Persons
description: Disabled Massachusetts residents (blind, paraplegic, or intellectually disabled) may qualify for free freshwater fishing and hunting licenses.
eligibility: First-time applicants submit application and physician letter
benefit_amount: FREE hunting and fishing licenses
how_to_apply: Submit application to MA Division of Fisheries & Wildlife Boston office
source_name: Massachusetts Division of Fisheries and Wildlife

name: Resident License Fees for Stationed Service Members
description: Nonresident service members stationed in Massachusetts are eligible to purchase hunting, trapping, and fishing licenses at resident prices.
benefit_amount: Resident prices on hunting/fishing/trapping licenses
how_to_apply: Purchase at resident rates with military ID and station orders
source_name: Massachusetts Division of Fisheries and Wildlife

name: Massachusetts Veterans' Cemeteries
description: Two state veterans' cemeteries in Agawam and Winchendon. Eligible veterans may be buried at no cost. Modest fee for burial of spouses and eligible dependents.
eligibility: Massachusetts resident OR died while MA resident
Spouses and dependents eligible with fee
benefit_amount: FREE burial for veterans; modest fee for spouses/dependents
how_to_apply: Contact Massachusetts EOVS for burial arrangements
source_name: Massachusetts Executive Office of Veterans Services

name: Veteran License Plates and ID Indicators
description: Special veteran license plates and Veteran indicator on driver's license, learner's permit, MA ID card, or Liquor ID card. Word 'Veteran' appears on card. No additional fees beyond regular transaction fees. Must visit full-service Registry branch (cannot be added online).
benefit_amount: Special veteran plates and ID indicators (no extra fee)
how_to_apply: Visit full-service RMV branch with DD-214
source_name: Massachusetts Registry of Motor Vehicles
